Am 01.02.10 19:17, schrieb mike amundsen:

> *** REQUEST
> POST /prove-it HTTP/1.1
> Host: www.example.org
> Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
> User-Agent: common-browser/1.0
> 
> captcha-image=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.example.org%2Fcaptcha-images%2Fa1s2d3f4g5.png&user-name=Mike&captcha-animal=kitten
> 
> *** RESPONSE
> HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
> Date: ...
> Server: smart-server/9.0
> ...
> Content-Type: text/html
> Content-Length: nnn
> 
> ...
> <p class="error">Sorry, that was not a photo of a kitten. You must not
> be human.</p>


Use used 400 bad request as response wich make sense. I used 412
precondition failed until now an I wonder if there is any reason to
prefer either one.

Philipp Meier
